name: Overleaf Lodge & Spa

reviews.title: Best Lodging on the Coast
reviews.text: The Overleaf is our favorite place to go. All rooms have ocean views and some have balconies and/or fireplaces. The hotel is 'green' and very serious about the environment. The 804 Trail goes right in front of the building; to the right is a long beach to walk on and to the left the trail goes all the way into Yachats, passing by the Adobe (where we often have dinner or drinks). We park our car and just walk everywhere. The Overleaf does not have a restaurant, but does include the best breakfast I have had anywhere--Bob's Red Mill hot cereal, delicious granola, yogurt, fruit, breads, and always two hot dishes. All of this is served on burl wood tables. The coffee is very good (unusual for many places). The staff are welcoming and the lobby comfortable. The hot tub on the third floor has the most wonderful view, and though located in the spa, is free.

reviews.title: Amazing!
reviews.text: This place is amazing! The room is gorgeous, clean and the best bed I have ever slept on. The amenities in the room are top notch. The pantry has gourmet foods and Trader Joe's products. The breakfast is delicious and the view is breathtaking. It is worth every penny and frankly, I think it is very reasonably priced for as high-end as it is. We look forward to returning here for years to come. We love the friendly and helpful staff as well, especially Joni. Highly recommended!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I booked a 3 night stay for our anniversary weekend in the Jacuzzu suite, Honestly, for the amount that we were paying I was expecting more. One of the registration clerks was down right rude. The other registration clerk was very nice and helpful. The carpet was filthy, especially in the hallways. The edges of the carpet in the room was filthy. I would expect paying that price that attention to detail in cleaning would be of utmost importance. For a high end hotel and spa the bed was hard. I expected to have nice linens. What we did get was linens equal to a lower end chain hotel. We only stayed the one night. Both of our backs and necks were so sore from the uncomfortable bed that we cancelled the remainder of our weekend there. We ended up going further up the coast and found a jacuzzi suite at half the price that was not only cleaner but higher quality.
reviews.title: Expensive, Average Hotel that needs a good cleaning.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place was recommended to me by my sister-in-law. It was WONDERFUL!
reviews.title: AHHHH---

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived after a day of cruising the coast....being chased by fog, and trying to stay ahead of it.
reviews.title: Terrific Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were on a week-long Oregon trip and stayed in one of the fireplace King bed rooms with a balcony. It was a little confusing to reserve a room on their site - they need to make the pictures and room descriptions match what you can reserve.
reviews.title: Great couple of days.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were on the third floor, there was an elevator and we knew before arriving that we were going to be eating a light dinner in the room a couple of times. So we had supplies and they had plenty of luggage carts, made for an easy transition when our friend dropped us off (we'd see him over the next couple of days, he was staying at another location with friends and we shared a car). We had also stopped at Tyee winery just outside of Corvallis and the Wine Vault in Philomath so we were pretty well stocked for the next couple of days.
reviews.title: Delightful weekend visit to Overleaf Lodge and Spa

reviews.text: We arrive in the rain! We've had drought so to hear the crashing waves through the open slider was a great delight. You are on the ocean and there is a nice ocean path to walk on the ocean side of the hotel. Along with a nice fire and a quick trip to the beautiful spa to soak - we had a lovely picnic watching football in the room and slept like babies (albeit snoring ones) the first night. The rain day was followed by another day of pounding sideways rain (we were enjoying an afternoon in the spa *smirk*) and then lucked out and had three beautiful days in Oregon with sunny, blue skies - but only one was at the Overleaf, we wished we had more time.
reviews.title: Gorgeous location on the Oregon Coast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast each morning was excellent, fresh fruit, plenty of juices and coffee, a freshly baked scone or other baked treat and a savory egg dish. There was also steel cut oats and cereal with raisins and other addins, but we were hooked on the daily eggs and fruit. We had considered going out to breakfast with our friend as he did not have a full breakfast, but after the first morning we let him spend the extra time with his friends.
reviews.title: Spectacular!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved the room and there was plenty of room in the nicely done bathroom. Aveda amenities were provided, along with wine glasses and you could get silverware and plates from the lobby if you wanted to borrow them. It would have been nice to have shower gel in addition to the shampoo and conditioner, I picked some up in the spa for a price. The room was clean and comfy.
reviews.title: Love love love

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved this place. It was perfect for our needs with comfortable rooms that all have refrigerators and microwaves in a small alcove, where there is a bar sink, and two bathroom sinks as well. Our room opened onto a patio with a view of the ocean, and was just off the 804 path that hugs the seashore for miles. The free breakfast was great. We also enjoyed the free access to the lodge's clean and spacious hot tubs, sauna, and steam room within their spa (where massages and such were available for a fee). There were also free laundry facilities available. The staff was friendly and very helpful, supplying us with dishes and cutlery so we could eat in our room. They made good recommendations for dinners out and let us check in early on our arrival date.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel on the Ocean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is very nice and in a great location. The room was so beautiful with a fireplace and jacuzzi. It was nice to sit in the jacuzzi and look out at the beautiful view from our room. The room was very clean and the bed was comfortable. The breakfast was good. The staff was very friendly and they even left flowers in our room for my 50th Birthday!
reviews.title: Nice Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On August 21, 2012, we were traveling south down the Oregon coast and knew that we wouldn't be able to get to Florence during the day. My wife found the Overleaf Lodge in the AAA tour book, made our reservation on the cell phone, and we arrived within 10 minutes. What a wonderful surprise to drive through the substantial trees and arrive at the Lodge. Great view from the room on the second floor. Waves breaking on the rocky shore. Room was spacious and clean. Breakfast was delicious. This was our first trip to Oregon and will probably not be back - but would highly recommend the Lodge for anyone traveling in the area. You will be very pleased. It is a great value!
reviews.title: Wonderful surprise

reviews.text: We spent 2 nights in Overleaf Lodge, but enjoyed it a lot. The location is perfect, right on the ocean line, and waves were just next to our balcony.
reviews.title: Beautiful location for your stay at the ocean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was spacious, with two bedrooms, fireplace and jacuzzi facing window with ocean view. There is also kitchen facilities, so that you can cook in the room. Also, there are number of restaurants nearby, with just 5-10 minutes walk.
reviews.title: View is worth every penny!

reviews.text: My sister and I stayed here for 3 nights in August 2012. We had a lovely handicapped accessible room on the second floor with great views from the balcony of crashing waves coming onshore. The public areas were beautiful. There is a great complimentary breakfast. A really nice walking trail winds in front of the hotel above the cliffs. We had a very relaxing experience, which was greatly needed. My sister had stayed at this place in the past, and really wanted to return. I certainly intend to come back. My only criticisms: the mattresses were too soft, especially for a handicapped room. My sister had great difficulty transferring from her bed to the wheelchair and back. Also, I asked for some extra time at check-out on a Monday morning, because it takes longer for my sister to get ready, and the front desk staff readily agreed. We were about an hour late, and I already had the front desk calling to see when we were going to be out of the room. Nonetheless, I definitely recommend the lodge.
reviews.title: Wonderful setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Overleaf Lodge & Spa is a first class hotel at reasonable prices. You can't get any closer to the ocean and their brunch is delicious. They are also ery accomodating... just this past week, I left all my credit cards and drivers license in my room and went on to Portland. You can imagine my panic when I discovered they were all gone. Thankfully, the maid who cleaned our room turned in my wallet and then an employee took the time to fax me copies of my cards so I could have some credibility with TSA! This same employee is mailing me my cards and license tomorrow. I love the Overleaf and will return next year.
reviews.title: Excellent Experiene

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: a beautiful resort, with a homey feel, the view and grounds are great..next time I would stay at the resort part where animals are allowed, view the same and staff were must more friendly..either place heavenly
reviews.title: Beautiful seaside resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Ovearleaf is very clean and quiet - a peacefull place. This is where you want to go to relax and unwind. The spa is amazing - they have a steam room that I really enjoyed, it was my first time in a steam room. I don't know of any other lodging on the Oregon Coast that has all this going for them.
reviews.title: There is always more to explore

reviews.text: Friendly staff
reviews.title: I love this place!

description: Refresh your outlook, rekindle your relationships and rejuvenate your spirit at our award-winning oceanfront resort and spa. All rooms are oceanfront and amazingly close to the ocean's waves pounding on the rocky coastline. Included with your stay is a wonderful fresh baked breakfast and access to our oceanfront spa where you can surrender to the healing power of the sea. Spa treatments are also available in our spa for a fee.
